III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The facility is a one-story building. It has small individual offices for all the workers, a
conference room, kitchen, playroom, and storage room. Lutheran Social Services of
Michigan leases a private office in the back of the building to a therapist. The space is
adequate for the services provided.
B. Program Description
Lutheran Social Services of Michigan (LSSM) contracts with the Michigan Family
Independence Agency, Community Mental Health Boards and other organizations to
offer general foster care to children, zero through 17 years old, who cannot live with
their families due to such factors as abuse, neglect, and abandonment. Social workers
are assigned to specific children and are responsible for case planning for the entire
time the children are in foster care placement. LSSM supports Michigan’s commitment
to permanency for children, with the primary goal of returning children to their homes if
at all possible. In cases where reunification with the birth family is not in the best
interest of the children, alternative permanency arrangements are pursued.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
None.
